# init(_:)

**Initializer**

Creates an object from a custom material’s specular property.

## Declaration

```swift
init(_ value: CustomMaterial.Specular)
```

## Parameters

- **value**: The custom material’s specular property.

## Discussion

RealityKit automatically draws *specular highlights* for physically based materials using the values of various properties, primarily [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicallyBasedMaterial/roughness-swift.property] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicallyBasedMaterial/metallic-swift.property]. Specular highlights are bright spots of reflected light that appear on shiny objects.



While many real-world objects can be accurately and realistically simulated with just the core PBR properties, you can create additional realistic effects by augmenting the specular highlights.

This initializer creates a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhysicallyBasedMaterial/Specular-swift.struct] object from the specular property of a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/CustomMaterial].

## Creating a specular object

- **init(floatLiteral:)**: Creates an object from single value.
- **init(scale:texture:)**: Creates an object from a single value or a texture.
